name: Frankfurt
fun_fact: Fun fact: Frankfurt's Apfelwein (apple wine) culture dates back centuries, and every sip reflects the soul and history of the Hessian region. The traditional ribbed glass with a diamond pattern is part of Frankfurt's cultural heritage!

hero_dishes.name: Frankfurter Gr√ºne So√üe (Frankfurt Green Sauce)
hero_dishes.description: Frankfurt's culinary flagship - a cold sauce made from exactly seven herbs: chives, parsley, chervil, borage, sorrel, burnet and cress. The herbs must be grown in or around Frankfurt for the sauce to merit the eponymous word in its name.
hero_dishes.origin_story: This fresh, herb-packed sauce has been the city's signature dish for centuries. The seven-herb combination creates a characteristic fresh flavor that often surprises first-time tasters who expect a warm sauce.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Served cold with boiled eggs and jacket potatoes, or as a fresh dip with fish or schnitzel at traditional Ebbelwei-Wirtschaften (apple wine pubs). Try Apfelweinwirtschaft Wagner (family-run since 1931) or Zum Gemalten Haus in Sachsenhausen.

hero_dishes.name: Frankfurter Schnitzel with Gr√ºne So√üe
hero_dishes.description: Veal schnitzel served with Frankfurt's famous green sauce and fried potatoes - the ultimate traditional Frankfurt meal.
hero_dishes.origin_story: This combination represents the heart of Frankfurt cuisine, pairing the tender veal schnitzel with the city's beloved seven-herb sauce.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Zum Gemalten Haus in Sachsenhausen district serves this iconic combination in an authentic apple wine tavern atmosphere.

signature_drinks.name: Apfelwein (Ebbelwoi)
signature_drinks.description: Apple wine pressed from the juiciest apples, fermented to create an unmistakably refreshing, slightly tangy flavor. Deeply rooted in Hessian tradition with a history stretching back centuries.
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Traditionally enjoyed from a ribbed glass with a diamond pattern (Geripptes). Purists drink it straight, but there are variations: 'Sauergespritzter' (mixed with mineral water) or 'S√º√ügespritzter' (mixed with lemonade for a softer flavor). Served in traditional Ebbelwei-Wirtschaften.

food_culture_notes: Traditional apple wine pubs (Ebbelwei-Wirtschaften) are the centerpiece of Frankfurt's cultural heritage, especially concentrated in Sachsenhausen on the southern side of the river Main
Frankfurt has a diverse dining scene beyond traditional food, with top-tier restaurants offering both traditional and contemporary cuisine at the highest level
The communal wooden tables in traditional taverns like Atschel (founded 1849) create a beer hall-style atmosphere where locals and visitors share meals together
Other traditional restaurants include Apfelweinwirtschaft Dauth-Schneider (known for generous portions of schnitzel and flammkuchen), Atschel, Frau Rauscher, Apfelwein Dax, and Apfelwein Solzer
